About the Channel

Mike Lane FRPS (Fellow of the Royal Photographic Society) is a full-time professional wildlife photographer specializing in birds and mammals. Although he travels extensively, his passion is British wildlife - finding more satisfaction photographing wrens and chaffinches than exotic birds in distant rainforests. Mike uses both Panasonic and Olympus M43 cameras, choosing each for different shooting scenarios.

Content Style

  • Hide photography specialist - teaching patient observation techniques
  • Clear, concise tutorials with no unnecessary fluff
  • Beautifully filmed productions with excellent narrative
  • Practical field advice from decades of experience
  • Quiet sense of humor that makes learning enjoyable

Why We Recommend This Channel

Mike‚Äôs videos are a masterclass in patience and technique. His philosophy that ‚Äúyou see more wildlife the less you move‚Äù permeates his teaching. With decades of professional experience, he shares insider knowledge on hide photography, fieldcraft, and getting close to British birds. His videos are consistently praised for being informative yet relaxing to watch.

Best For

  • Garden bird photography enthusiasts
  • Those wanting to learn hide photography
  • British wildlife photographers
  • Understanding field craft and patience
  • Professional-level techniques made accessible

Photography Philosophy

Mike is a ‚Äúgreat sitter‚Äù who spends more time in bird hides than perhaps anyone else. He likens it to fishing - quiet, patient, and deeply relaxing. His approach prioritizes observation and understanding wildlife behavior over gear specs.

Key Expertise

  • Hide photography setup and techniques
  • Small bird photography especially British species
  • Garden photography making the most of your backyard
  • Birds in flight at close range
  • M43 system optimization for wildlife
